text: Toab is the most southerly village on Mainland, Shetland, Scotland. It is part of Virkie and overlooks Sumburgh Airport. Toab is within the parish of Dunrossness. There is a village shop and post office in Toab. The name Toab may come from the old Norse hópr or hóp meaning a small landlocked bay or lagoon. ==References== ==External links== *Canmore - Broch of Toab site record *Canmore - Toab, Maybury site record Category:Villages in Mainland, Shetland
title: Toab, Shetland
